name: Faralda

aspects.trouble: No Patience for the Unworthy or Unprepared
other_aspects: Master of Destruction Magic—Fire, Frost, and Shock
Guards the College's Standards and Traditions

stunts: Destruction Specialist: +2 to Lore when casting Destruction spells of any element
Ward the Gates: +2 to Notice when detecting threats approaching the College
Elemental Mastery: Can switch between fire, frost, and shock damage types freely in same scene
notes: Faralda is the College's gatekeeper, stationed at the bridge that connects Winterhold town to the College. She administers the admission test to all prospective students, ensuring only those with genuine magical ability enter. She's stern and exacting but fair—she respects competence and dedication. Her mastery of Destruction magic makes her a formidable guardian.
combat_tactics: Faralda fights at range with Destruction spells, switching elements based on enemy resistances. She's aggressive and precise, using area effects to control battlefield. She maintains wards defensively but prefers offense. In College defense scenarios, she holds the bridge—a natural chokepoint—making her nearly impossible to bypass.
social_interaction: Faralda is direct, challenging, and somewhat intimidating. She doesn't suffer fools and her admission test doubles as personality assessment—she's evaluating character as much as magical skill. Those who pass earn her respect; those who fail or complain are dismissed. She warms slightly to proven mages but maintains professional distance.

relationships.College Faculty: Respected peer, takes her gatekeeping role seriously

personality_notes.speaking_style: Direct and challenging, formal and precise, no unnecessary words
motivations: Maintain College's standards—only worthy mages enter
Protect the College from external threats
Advance Destruction magic theory and practice
fears: Admitting someone who harms the College
quirks: Stands perfectly still while watching bridge approaches
Adjusts focus when assessing magical auras
Slight nod is highest praise she gives

admission_test.purpose: Verify magical ability and assess character before entry
admission_test.requirements: Cast spell of any school to demonstrate competence
admission_test.alternatives: Letters of recommendation from court wizards, special circumstances, Dragon-related urgency
admission_test.pass_criteria: Successfully cast requested spell or demonstrate equivalent ability
admission_test.fail_consequences: Denied entry, must return with better preparation
admission_test.personality_test: Observes how applicants handle pressure and criticism
admission_test.special_cases: May waive test for recognized Dragonborn or those bearing urgent messages

teaching_role.philosophy: Power without control is useless; control without power is meaningless
teaching_role.lessons: Elemental damage types, area effects, magical precision under pressure
teaching_role.standards: Expects perfection, accepts nothing less than best effort
teaching_role.success_metric: Students who can defend themselves and others competently

story_hooks: Administers admission test—first major College interaction
Offers advanced Destruction training to capable students
Defends bridge during Eye of Magnus crisis
May request party investigate magical threats near College
Source of powerful Destruction spell tomes

dialogue_samples.greeting: You wish to enter the College? Then you must demonstrate your worth. The College doesn't accept just anyone. Show me you can cast *any* spell, and we'll talk.
dialogue_samples.test_passed: Adequate. You have potential. Enter, and do not waste the opportunity. The College of Winterhold is not to be trifled with.
dialogue_samples.test_failed: Insufficient. The College has standards. Return when you're properly prepared.
dialogue_samples.teaching: Destruction magic is not about anger—it's about precision. Channel your power through focus, not fury. Again. Better.
dialogue_samples.defending: They dare approach the College with hostile intent? Let them learn why our standards are high. *lightning crackles* This bridge is my domain.

gm_notes: Faralda is the College's first impression—make her memorable. Her test can be roleplay opportunity or skill challenge depending on party. She's stern but not cruel; she genuinely wants to maintain quality. In combat, she's devastating on the bridge chokepoint. Use her to establish College's competence and standards. Players who earn her respect gain valuable ally and trainer.
